Html: I didn't see this noted anywhere or posted anywhere, but Rawr does not play nicely with Vista. It's more of an issue with Vista than it is with Rawr, but I think it might be worth noting either on the home page or in a wiki somewhere.$0$0$0$0Rawr needs to be installed to a public folder on Vista or else you will have permissions issues when loading and saving the XML character files.$0
This is quite untrue. Rawr works fine on Vista. As with any OS, Rawr needs to be somewhere you have permissions to read/write, that's all.

I can't get it to work on Vista. I downloaded version 2.1.3 and unpacked it with 7-Zip and when I start the program I see a flash screen and then the application dies.

I'm running the program as an administrator who has full rights to the folder where the application resides.
tbresson, please uninstall the .NET Framework, and reinstall the latest version from Microsoft. Let me know if that doesn't solve the issue for you.
It has always worked for on vista for me

All updates from Windows Update are installed.

I tried downloading .NET 3.5 SP-1 and installed it without problems but it still doesn't work.
Be sure to uninstall whatever versions of .NET Framework you have already, before installing 3.5 SP1. Did you do that?

I can't uninstall any Framework besides the one I just installed. There's no .Net Framework on my Uninstall list.
It's probably due to the fact that .NET comes with Vista ?

I've uninstalled the version I've installed and trying to install it again but I don't think it'll work.

UPDATE: It didn't.
I am also having the same problem, though I am not very familiar with .Net Framework can anyone run me through uninstalling and reinstalling it and where to reinstall it?

Pallysmacker: Add/Remove Programs control panel

tbresson: I'm running out of ideas... :(    Try re-downloading it and unzipping it with the standard windows explorer functionality, being sure to preserve folders, and not running it from within the zip, of course.

I've reinstalled Vistsa and now it works :)

I had some issues with my Vista installation after trying out Microsoft's Language Packs (don't use those if you like your installation). I got no help from the MSDN forum so I decided to reinstall. Apparently that helped with the Rawr problem aswell.

Just wanted to let you know.
